title: Problems with wxPython not allowing deeplabcut[gui] install on Windows 10
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I am trying to do a new install of DLC with the GUI, and every time I try I get an error that prevents installation. Every other topic I can find where someone had this issue seems to be Linux/Ubuntu specific, but I am on Windows 10.

### Operating System

Windows 10

### DeepLabCut version

(trying to install the latest one, not successful yet)

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

In anaconda environment:
`pip install deeplabcut[gui]`

Everything goes smoothly until the code below.

### Relevant log output

```shell
Building wheels for collected packages: wxpython
  Building wheel for wxpython (setup.py) ... error
  ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
   command: 'C:\Users\ckelly\Anaconda3\envs\dlc\python.exe' -u -c 'import io, os, sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'C:\\Users\\ckelly\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-l5f7lqo0\\wxpython_7860fedbfb274deb8a567c6351fd0ef4\\setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'C:\\Users\\ckelly\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-l5f7lqo0\\wxpython_7860fedbfb274deb8a567c6351fd0ef4\\setup.py'"'"';f = getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__) if os.path.exists(__file__) else io.StringIO('"'"'from setuptools import setup; setup()'"'"');code = f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' bdist_wheel -d 'C:\Users\ckelly\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-wheel-3rpx0zve'
```

### Anything else?

Program Versions (if this helps): 
- Python 3.9.7
- cudatoolkit 11.2.2
- cuDNN 8.1.0.77
- tensorflow 2.5.0

Troubleshooting attempts so far:
I have tried installing wxPython separately with both pip and conda install. Using conda-forge I can successfully install wxython on its own but still get the same error when attempting to pip install deeplabcut.
